alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 1:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LEWIS, EAST CENTRAL BROWN, ADAMS, FAYETTE, EASTERN CLINTON, WESTERN PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN GREENE, HIGHLAND, WESTERN SCIOTO AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 127 PM EDT, showers were located along a line extending from near Jamestown to near Rome, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Hillsboro, Greenfield, West Union, Sabina, Manchester, Peebles, Vanceburg, Lynchburg, Leesburg, New Vienna, Jeffersonville, Winchester, Marshall, Seaman, Bainbridge, Camp Dix, Highland Holiday and Head of Grassy. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 50 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
